Converter.convert module#

class Converter.convert.Convert[source]#

Bases: object

Class for converting various elements to “standard” and/or special elements

static ASS_color_to_hex_color(color: str) → str | None[source]#

Converts ASS color formatting to hexadecimal color format

Args:

`py color (str): Color to convert `

Returns:

`py str: Convert color `

&H`BBGGRR`& –> #`RRGGBB`

static create_styles(Events: dict) → dict[str, str | int][source]#

Create styles for tags common to all dialogs

Args:

`py Events (dict): Dictionary of events containing the tags `

Returns:

`py dict[str, str | int]: Dialogs styles ` ```json {

“Exemple”: {
“Fontname”: “Arial”,

“Fontsize”: 48, “PrimaryColour”: “#FFFF00FF”, “SecondaryColour”: “#000000FF”, “OutlineColour”: “#00000000”, “BackColour”: “#00000000”, “Bold”: 0, “Italic”: “-1”, “Underline”: 0,

…

}

static get_tags_use(Events: dict, Styles: dict, i: int) → dict[str, str | int] | None[source]#

Builds the Dict of tags used in the dialog being processed

Args:

`py Events (dict): Dict of dialogues Styles (dict): Dict of styles i (int): Dialog line name `

Returns:

`py list[str | dict[str, str]]: Dict of tags `

`py str: Convert color `

static to_ASS(Parts: dict, title: str, dim: str = '1280x720', dir: str = './') → None[source]#

Converts loaded subtitle to ASS format (even if the file in the input is an ASS file)

Args:

`py Parts (dict): Dict containing dialogues and styles dir (str): Output dir title (str): Output filename (without extension) dim (str): Video size for script adaptation. Example: 1920x1080 `
